text: D'Elbée Protecting the Republican Prisoners After the Vicomte Edmond Marie Félix de Boislecomte (28 April 1849, Arras - 1923, Arras) was a French painter of genre and historical scenes. == Biography == He was awarded a law degree in Paris in 1871."Edmond Boislecomte (1849-1923)", Ressources de la Bibliothèque nationale de France Online Later, he studied at the Académie Julian, in the studios of Jean-Paul Laurens and Catalogue de la 27e exposition de la Société des Amis des Arts de la Somme, à Amiens en 1885, p.11 He was married to Marguerite de Marbot, the granddaughter of General Marbot"Il a conquis un general" Online @ Paris Normandie. In 1879, he began exhibiting historical and Orientalist scenes at the annual Salon. His works are preserved and may be seen at the , , , Musée des Beaux-Arts de Rouen, and the Palais des Beaux-Arts de Lille.Base Joconde == References == == External links == Category:1849 births Category:1923 deaths Category:French painters Category:French genre painters Category:French history painters Category:French orientalists Category:People from Arras
title: Edmond Marie Félix de Boislecomte
